content:
Hi @Dolmen1234 : already approved by the Community, but i still can upVote your Contribution :+1 : !
-> cf. my comment in the Forum :
 https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-panel-count/202645/3
I liked it.  Perfectly suited for Linq in C#.  I did it in four lines.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Might be on the harder side of 'easy', but still fine.

Fun puzzle, but it takes me some times to figure out why the last test was not working, the same type of cases with less entry or a different title (like 'Names repeating' instead of 'Formulas repeating') will make it more clear.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed solving this puzzle. The statement presents a clear guideline, so instead of spending a lot of time in getting to understand the goal, with this puzzle I could simply spend all time on coding up the solution.

Did you think about adding 'OR'?

I did like to solve this puzzle, to me it is a straightforward string parsing challenge in which the statement provided a clear guideline. Potentially, with 'OR' my time of having fun with this puzzle could be double (you can then easily add a couple of cases with only or and combinations of AND and OR, and the added logical challenge would be both straightforward and make the implementation more challenging).
Parsing text may be easier in some languages and a real pain in others.

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
Your CG credentials are outstanding, so I'm very interested in your opinion. I enjoyed your puzzle, but I thought it should be classified as easy. Are there any particular reasons you chose medium?

* Contributions must be written in English, see: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

Constraints section
* Please format the [[variables]].

Tags
* Why "Streams"?

Cases
* Please avoid using any non-ASCII characters in input or output because the CodinGame console cannot show those characters correctly.

Thanks.

Goal section
* Please change "ex" to "e.g." (3 times).

Input section
* Please format *all* line numbers in <<bold>> e.g. <<First Line>> and <<[[P]] next lines>>.

* Please delete all examples (you've mentioned them in Goal section already).

* Please change "individu" to "person".

* Please delete "his" (twice) because the person may be female.

* Please add "space-separated" before "[[properties]]".

Output section
* Please format "[[F]] lines" in <<bold>>.

Constraints section
* Please change all "<" to "≤".

Input/Output/Constraints section
* Please use the same variable names as those used in the stub generator.

Difficulty level
* This puzzles seems to be Easy instead of Medium.

Thanks.

I felt that it can't be solved in a few minutes, and there are some traps in the test cases. So I thought it was a bit over easy. However, as both you and 5DN1L suggest that it should be an easy puzzle, I changed the difficulty.
Thanks

Good idea. I thought about it, but I'm afraid this would be too complicated, handling positions and priorities of AND/OR operators.
I could make a v2 medium puzzle, but not before this one (hopefully) gets approved.
